verdict: Conversion tracking issues and duplicate PMax campaigns diluting performance; fundamentals show promise

checks.name: Conversion actions defined
checks.finding: 6 conversion actions configured

checks.name: Micro vs macro separation
checks.finding: Local actions - Menu views set as Primary — micro action inflating conversion count

checks.name: No duplicate counting
checks.finding: 3 overlapping call tracking actions: Calls from ads + Click to call website OLD + Clicks to call Google-hosted. Triple-counting phone interactions

checks.name: Legacy actions cleanup
checks.finding: 'Click to call website OLD' still active as Primary — stale conversion action should be removed or set to Secondary

checks.name: Store visits tracking
checks.finding: Store visits tracked as Primary — appropriate for a local spa business

checks.name: Wasted spend on irrelevant terms
checks.finding: Desktop-only PMax: $5,635 for 32.5 conv ($173 CPA) vs main PMax: $12,625 for 142 conv ($89 CPA). Desktop-only variant is 2x more expensive per conversion

checks.name: Duplicate PMax waste
checks.finding: Two PMax campaigns targeting same service area — Desktop Only version dilutes data and increases costs

checks.name: Campaign naming convention
checks.finding: Mix of naming styles: 'Performance Max - OmSpa' vs 'Theomspanaples - Search V2'

checks.name: Campaign count per objective
checks.finding: 8 campaigns is reasonable but 2 duplicate PMax is inefficient

checks.name: Brand vs Non-Brand separation
checks.finding: No dedicated brand search campaign. Search V2 appears to target both brand and non-brand

checks.name: PMax present for eligible accounts
checks.finding: PMax active and the primary spend driver

checks.name: Budget allocation matches priority
checks.finding: 94% of budget in PMax. Search V2 only $1,144 — limited search insights

checks.name: Search campaign Quality Score
checks.finding: Search V2 CTR 7.4% is decent for spa queries. SIS 33.1% means missing 2/3 of searches

checks.name: Keyword coverage
checks.finding: Only 1 search campaign active. Search clicks campaign enabled but $0 spend — broken or limited keywords

checks.name: Search impression share
checks.finding: SIS 33-48% across campaigns — significant opportunity being missed

checks.name: CTR vs industry benchmark
checks.finding: Main PMax 4.9% CTR is above average. Search 7.4% CTR is solid

checks.name: PMax audience signals
checks.finding: Two PMax campaigns — unclear how audience signals differ between them

checks.name: PMax brand cannibalization
checks.finding: No brand campaign exists, so PMax is likely serving on brand terms at higher cost

checks.name: Smart bidding strategy active
checks.finding: PMax uses Max Conv Value. Search V2 uses Max Conversions. Search clicks uses Target Spend (suboptimal)

checks.name: Budget constrained campaigns
checks.finding: PMax SIS 48.1% — missing half of available impressions

checks.name: Target Spend campaign
checks.finding: Search clicks campaign uses Target Spend with $0 spend — either broken or should be paused

quickWins.action: Set Menu views to Secondary — micro conversion inflating count
Remove 'Click to call website OLD' — stale duplicate call tracking
Consolidate to 1 call tracking action — keep Calls from ads as Primary, set others to Secondary
Pause Desktop Only PMax — consolidate into main PMax for better data aggregation and lower CPA
Pause or fix Search clicks campaign ($0 spend, Target Spend bidding)
Launch a brand Search campaign to capture brand terms cheaply before PMax

items: Clean conversion tracking: GA4 Purchase + Calls from ads + Store visits as Primary only
Remove OLD click to call and Menu views from Primary
Consolidate to single PMax campaign (pause Desktop Only variant)
Pause Search clicks campaign (Target Spend, $0 activity)
Launch dedicated brand Search campaign to capture brand terms at lower cost
Expand Search V2 keywords and increase budget to improve 33.1% SIS
After PMax consolidation, monitor CPA improvement with unified data
Add remarketing audiences as signals to PMax
Increase PMax SIS from 48% toward 65%+ as conversion tracking improves
Launch non-brand Search campaigns for treatment-specific queries
Build Customer Match list from booking system
Test seasonal promotions via Demand Gen
